questions.rationale: This is a difference of squares. Using the FOIL method: First (\(x \times x = x^2\)), Outer (\(x \times 4 = 4x\)), Inner (\(-4 \times x = -4x\)), Last (\(-4 \times 4 = -16\)). The middle terms cancel out: \(x^2 + 4x - 4x - 16 = x^2 - 16\).

questions.question: The sum of two consecutive integers is 37. What are the integers?

answerOptions.rationale: Let the integers be \(n\) and \(n+1\). \(n + (n+1) = 37\). \(2n + 1 = 37\). \(2n = 36\). \(n = 18\). The integers are 18 and 19.

answerOptions.rationale: The area of a rectangle is length times width. \(8 \(	imes\) 5 = 40.\)
This is the perimeter of the rectangle.
This is the sum of the length and width.
This would be the area if it were a square with side 8.

questions.question: What is the circumference of a circle with a radius of 5 cm? (Use \(\pi \approx 3.14\))

answerOptions.rationale: This is the semi-circumference (\(\pi r\)).
The formula for circumference is \(C = 2\pi r\). So, \(C = 2 \(	imes\) 3.14 \(	imes 5 = 31.4 cm.\)
This is the area of the circle (\(\pi r^{2}\)).
This is the diameter of the circle.

questions.question: Two angles in a triangle measure 40 degrees and 60 degrees. What is the measure of the third angle?

answerOptions.rationale: The sum of angles in a triangle is always 180 degrees. \(180 - (40 + 60) = 180 - 100 = 80 degrees.\)
This is the sum of the two given angles.
This would only be true for a right-angled triangle where the other two angles sum to 90.
The third angle can be determined with the given information.

questions.question: What is the volume of a cube with a side length of 4 inches?

answerOptions.rationale: This is the sum of the side lengths (4+4+4).
This is the area of one face of the cube.
The volume of a cube is the side length cubed. \(V = s^{3} = 4^{3} = 64 cubic inches.\)
This is the surface area of the cube (\(6 \(	imes\)s^{2}).
